result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: February 24, 2016, Sentencing Hearing, filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter. Transcript maintained in file 15CF371.

Defendant Tyrone A Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.   

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  15CF374  Calendar call scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Copy sent to Defense Attorney Bihler and DA's Office.
Court will address on the next court date - unless Atty. Bihler requests it be brought in earlier.
Hearing at 02-11-2016 09:30 am

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tyrone A Daniels in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.

Atty. Bihler withdraws the SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defense requests to argue bail modification.

State objects and presented arguments.

Court Denies - Motion for Bail Modification.
Bail and Conditions remain as previously fixed.
